Articles.Content:
When adjusting slider values in the VAB or SPH (e.g. thrust limiter, gimbal limit, etc..) it is infuriating to not be able "slide" to the precise value I want.

It would be extremely pleasing to be able to manually input these values with the keyboard after, say, shift-clicking or crtl-clicking the slider bar.

(ps. if there is a mod for this functionality please direct me to it!)
I... just..... want..... 50%.... thrust.... limiter..... GAH!
Or you click on the number its currently on and you just type in whichever value you need.
I agree with things such as these.

it happened!! 

"* Add capability for text entry on float fields in the Part Action Window"

thank you @SQUAD

Is there a console edition feature for this?


I found the option, without the cursor up, it is RB + Y on xbox. In this highlighting menu, x allows you to change the input change rate while the joystick modifies the slider by said rate.

Edited April 25, 2020 by The kerbalwockey
Based on key terms used in this forum I refined my search and found the answer on redit.
X does not change the rate, only the value it changes if the option has more than one. For example, angle limits on robotic parts. If anyone knows how to change the rate, that would be awesome.
